1	and each succeeding opportunity for observation has given the impression an added depth by convincing me more emphatically of that fitness which I had preconceived [CM] and thus evoking more decisively those affections to which I have but now referred [P] Our conversations have [CM] I think [CM] made sufficiently clear to you the tenor of my life and purposes [CN] a tenor unsuited [CM] I am aware [CM] to the commoner order of minds [P] But I have discerned in you an elevation of thought and a capability of devotedness [CM] which I had hitherto not conceived to be compatible either with the early bloom of youth or with those graces of sex that may be said at once to win and to confer distinction when combined [CM] as they notably are in you [CM] with the mental qualities above indicated [P] It was [CM] I confess [CM] beyond my hope to meet with this rare combination of elements both solid and attractive [CM] adapted to supply aid in graver labors and to cast a charm over vacant hours [S] and but for the event of my introduction to you which [CM] let me again say [CM] I trust not to be superficially coincident with foreshadowing needs [CM] but providentially related thereto as stages towards the completion of a life s plan [CM] I should presumably have gone on to the last without any attempt to lighten my solitariness by a matrimonial union [P] Such [CM] my dear [PN] [PN] [CM] is the accurate statement of my feelings [S] and I rely on your kind indulgence in venturing now to ask you how far your own are of a nature to confirm my happy presentiment [P] To be accepted by you as your husband and the earthly guardian of your welfare [CM] I should regard as the highest of providential gifts [P] In return I can at least offer you an affection hitherto unwasted 1	[PB] He was a man of about sixty [CM] handsomely dressed [CM] haughty in manner [CM] and with a face like a fine mask [P] A face of a transparent paleness [S] every feature in it clearly defined [S] one set expression on it [P] The nose [CM] beautifully formed otherwise [CM] was very slightly pinched at the top of each nostril [P] In those two compressions [CM] or dints [CM] the only little change that the face ever showed [CM] resided [P] They persisted in changing colour sometimes [CM] and they would be occasionally dilated and contracted by something like a faint pulsation [S] then [CM] they gave a look of treachery [CM] and cruelty [CM] to the whole countenance [P] Examined with attention [CM] its capacity of helping such a look was to be found in the line of the mouth [CM] and the lines of the orbits of the eyes [CM] being much too horizontal and thin [S] still [CM] in the effect of the face made [CM] it was a handsome face [CM] and a remarkable one [P] [PB] Its owner went downstairs into the courtyard [CM] got into his carriage [CM] and drove away [P] Not many people had talked with him at the reception [S] he had stood in a little space apart [CM] and [PN] might have been warmer in his manner [P] It appeared [CM] under the circumstances [CM] rather agreeable to him to see the common people dispersed before his horses [CM] and often barely escaping from being run down [P] His man drove as if he were charging an enemy [CM] and the furious recklessness of the man brought no check into the face [CM] or to the lips [CM] of the master [P] The complaint had sometimes made itself audible [CM] even in that deaf city and dumb age [CM] that [CM] in the narrow streets without footways [CM] the fierce patrician custom of hard driving endangered and maimed the mere vulgar in a barbarous manner [P] But [CM] few cared enough for that to think of it a second time [CM] and [CM] in this matter [CM] as in all others [CM] the common wretches were left to get out of their difficulties as they could[NL]
